ground_truth: The gantry turns, moving Bond away from the gun and pulling Mitchell off the scaffold. The rogue agent lands on a scaffold tower, as Bond pulls at the rope around his leg. He climbs for a gun on the scaffold while Bond tries to reach the one on the ground. Both scoop up the weapons, and Bond fires. The crowds are dispersing in the Town Square as a police car makes its way down a crowded street. Covered in dust, Bond strides through the crowds towards the wooden gate in the tunnel. Blood stains the cellar floor, but the prisoner, Mr. White, is gone. Bond stares dispassionately at the scene. It's raining when a black Range Rover arrives at a high-rise block of flats. M stands looking out from one of the balconies. Bond emerges from the Range Rover and enters through the building's glass door. Ignoring a stolid guard, Bond enters a flat, passes masked forensics officers, and joins M on the balcony. The boffin opens a door for M. Bond's eyes narrow as he is now wearing shades in the back of a taxi, driving down a dusty street. He gets out of the taxi opposite the faded sign and entrance to the Hotel Dessalines. In a dark polo shirt and light trousers, he enters the building and makes his way through the drab-tiled lobby, strung with washing lines. He moves down plain concrete corridors, arrives at a door, and positions himself to one side of it. He uses a tool to pick the lock and enters cautiously, peering around the door into the plainly furnished, empty living room. Closing the door behind him, he walks into the apartment when a switch-blade flicks open. A man leaps through glass doors, swinging the blade wildly. Bond slams him through the glass into the bedroom. The man recovers and swings again, but Bond attacks with the phone. He goes down and finds a pair of scissors. Bond slams him into a wall, gets head-butted, then hits him with a book. He parries the knife blows and grabs the guy's knife hand in a finger-breaking hold. They go through a window out onto a balcony. Bond has him by the throat and drives the scissors into the guy's neck and thigh. Bond's completely unmoved as the guy rolls his eyes in agony, then dies, blood pooling beneath his head. He goes to search the rooms, taking a shirt from a wardrobe and ripping it to make a bandage for a cut on his arm. He shrugs on a shirt and wipes blood from his nose. Barely glancing at the body, he grabs the door keys and heads downstairs. He turns to the young black woman at reception with a grim demeanor.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: The framework rotates, shifting Bond away from the firearm and drawing Mitchell from the platform. The renegade operative lands on a framework tower, as Bond tugs at the cord around his limb. He ascends for a firearm on the platform while Bond attempts to attain the one on the terrain. Both seize the armaments, and Bond discharges. The throngs are scattering in the Town Square as a patrol vehicle progresses down a congested avenue. Enveloped in dust, Bond strides through the throngs toward the wooden portal in the passage. Crimson blemishes the basement floor, but the captive, Mr. White, is absent. Bond gazes impassively at the tableau. It's raining when a black Range Rover arrives at a skyscraper block of flats. M stands looking out from one of the balconies. Bond emerges from the Range Rover and enters through the building's glass portal. Ignoring a solid guard, Bond enters a flat, passes masked forensics officers, and joins M on the balcony. The expert opens a portal for M. Bond's eyes narrow as he is now wearing spectacles in the back of a cab, traversing a dusty avenue. He exits the cab opposite the weathered sign and entrance to the Hotel Dessalines. In a dark polo shirt and light trousers, he enters the building and makes his way through the dull-tiled lobby, strung with washing cords. He moves down bare concrete corridors, arrives at a portal, and positions himself to one flank of it. He uses an implement to pick the lock and enters cautiously, peering around the portal into the plainly furnished, empty living room. Closing the portal behind him, he walks into the apartment when a switch-blade flicks open. A man leaps through glass portals, swinging the blade wildly. Bond slams him through the glass into the bedroom. The man recovers and swings again, but Bond attacks with the handset. He goes down and finds a pair of shears. Bond slams him into a wall, gets head-butted, then hits him with a volume. He parries the knife strikes and grabs the guy's knife hand in a finger-breaking hold. They go through a window out onto a balcony. Bond has him by the throat and drives the shears into the guy's neck and thigh. Bond's completely unmoved as the guy rolls his eyes in agony, then dies, blood pooling beneath his head. He goes to search the rooms, taking a shirt from a wardrobe and ripping it to make a bandage for a cut on his arm. He shrugs on a shirt and wipes blood from his nose. Barely glancing at the body, he grabs the portal keys and heads downstairs. He turns to the young black woman at reception with a stern demeanor.

test_cases.description: The gantry is turned, and Bond is moved away from the gun, while Mitchell is pulled off the scaffold. A scaffold tower is landed on by the rogue agent, as the rope is pulled at by Bond around his leg. The gun on the scaffold is climbed for by him while the one on the ground is tried to be reached by Bond. The weapons are scooped up by both, and a shot is fired by Bond. In the Town Square, the crowds disperse as a police car is made its way down a crowded street. Covered in dust, the crowds are strode through by Bond towards the wooden gate in the tunnel. The cellar floor is stained with blood, but Mr. White, the prisoner, has gone. The scene is stared at dispassionately by Bond. It rains when a black Range Rover is arrived by at a high-rise block of flats. M looks out from one of the balconies. Emerging from the Range Rover, the building's glass door is entered through by Bond. A stolid guard is ignored, and a flat is entered by him, as masked forensics officers are passed, and M is joined by Bond on the balcony. The door is opened by the boffin for M. Bond's eyes narrow, and now shades are worn by him in the back of a taxi that drives down a dusty street. Out of the taxi opposite the faded sign and entrance to the Hotel Dessalines, he gets. In a dark polo shirt and light trousers, the building is entered by him, and the drab-tiled lobby, strung with washing lines, is made his way through. Moving down plain concrete corridors, the door is arrived at by him, and to one side of it, he positions himself. A tool is used by him to pick the lock and he enters cautiously, peering into the plainly furnished, empty living room around the door. The door is closed behind him, and into the apartment he walks when a switchblade is flicked open. Through glass doors, a man leaps and swings the blade wildly. The man is slammed through the glass into the bedroom by Bond. The man recovers and swings again, but with the phone, an attack is made by Bond. Going down, a pair of scissors is found by him. The man is slammed into a wall by Bond, gets head-butted, then with a book, he hits him. The knife blows are parried, and the guy's knife hand is grabbed in a finger-breaking hold by him. A window is gone through by them out onto a balcony. The man is held by Bond by the throat and the scissors are driven into the man's neck and thigh. The man’s eyes roll in agony, then he dies, the blood pools beneath his head, while Bond is left completely unmoved. The rooms are searched by him, taking a shirt from a wardrobe and ripping it to make a bandage for a cut on his arm. A shirt is shrugged on, and the blood is wiped from his nose. Barely glancing at the body, the door keys are grabbed by him, and downstairs he heads. The young black woman at reception is turned to by him with a grim demeanor.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: The gantry turns, moving Bond from the gun and pulling Mitchell off the scaffold. The rogue agent lands on a scaffold tower as Bond pulls the rope around his leg. He climbs for a gun on the scaffold while Bond reaches for one on the ground. Both grab their weapons, and Bond fires. Crowds disperse in the Town Square as a police car navigates a crowded street. Covered in dust, Bond strides through the crowd toward the wooden gate in the tunnel. Blood stains the cellar floor, but Mr. White, the prisoner, is gone. Bond stares dispassionately. It's raining when a black Range Rover arrives at a high-rise. M looks out from a balcony. Bond exits the Range Rover and enters the building's glass door. Ignoring a stolid guard, Bond enters a flat, passes masked forensics officers, and joins M on the balcony. The boffin opens a door for M. Bond, now wearing shades, is in the back of a taxi on a dusty street. He exits opposite the faded sign of Hotel Dessalines. In a dark polo shirt and light trousers, he enters the building, moving through the drab-tiled lobby with washing lines. He navigates plain corridors, arrives at a door, and picks the lock. Entering cautiously, he peers into the empty living room. Closing the door, he walks in when a switchblade flicks open. A man leaps through glass doors, swinging the blade. Bond slams him through the glass into the bedroom. The man recovers and swings again, but Bond attacks with the phone. He finds scissors, slams the man into a wall, gets head-butted, then hits him with a book. He parries knife blows and grabs the man's knife hand in a finger-breaking hold. They go through a window onto a balcony. Bond grips his throat and drives scissors into his neck and thigh. Unmoved, Bond watches as the man dies, blood pooling beneath his head. He searches the rooms, takes a shirt from a wardrobe, and makes a bandage for his arm. He puts on a shirt, wipes blood from his nose, barely glances at the body, grabs the door keys, and heads downstairs. He turns to the young black woman at reception with a grim demeanor.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: The gantry moves Bond from the gun, pulling Mitchell off the scaffold. The rogue agent lands on a scaffold tower as Bond pulls the rope around his leg. Both grab guns, and Bond fires. Crowds disperse in the Town Square as a police car navigates a crowded street. Dust-covered, Bond strides through the crowd to the wooden gate in the tunnel. Blood stains the cellar floor, but Mr. White is gone. Bond stares dispassionately. It's raining when a black Range Rover arrives at a high-rise. M looks out from a balcony. Bond exits the Range Rover, enters the building, and joins M on the balcony, passing masked forensics officers. Bond, now wearing shades, rides in a taxi to the Hotel Dessalines. In a dark polo and light trousers, he enters the drab-tiled lobby, moves through concrete corridors, and picks a lock to enter a plain living room. A man with a switchblade attacks. Bond slams him through glass into a bedroom. The man recovers, but Bond attacks with a phone, then a book, and parries knife blows. They go through a window onto a balcony. Bond drives scissors into the man's neck and thigh, killing him. Unmoved, Bond searches the rooms, makes a bandage for his arm, and wipes blood from his nose. He grabs door keys and heads downstairs, turning to the young woman at reception with a grim demeanor.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: The gantry slowly and deliberately turns, gradually moving Bond away from the gun and simultaneously pulling Mitchell off the scaffold. The rogue agent, with a sudden jolt, lands precariously on a scaffold tower, while Bond, with determination, pulls at the rope tightly wound around his leg. He begins to climb, reaching for a gun positioned on the scaffold, as Bond simultaneously tries to reach the one lying on the ground. Both men manage to scoop up their respective weapons, and Bond fires with precision. Meanwhile, the crowds are rapidly dispersing in the bustling Town Square as a police car carefully makes its way down the crowded street. Covered in a layer of dust, Bond strides purposefully through the throngs of people towards the wooden gate leading into the tunnel. Blood stains are visible on the cellar floor, but the prisoner, Mr. White, is nowhere to be found. Bond stares dispassionately at the scene, his expression unreadable. It's raining steadily when a sleek black Range Rover arrives at a towering high-rise block of flats. M stands pensively, looking out from one of the balconies. Bond emerges from the Range Rover and enters through the building's glass door. Ignoring a stolid guard who stands watch, Bond enters a flat, passing by masked forensics officers, and joins M on the balcony. The boffin opens a door for M, allowing her to enter. Bond's eyes narrow as he is now wearing shades while seated in the back of a taxi, which is driving down a dusty street. He gets out of the taxi opposite the faded sign and entrance to the Hotel Dessalines. Dressed in a dark polo shirt and light trousers, he enters the building and makes his way through the drab-tiled lobby, which is strung with washing lines. He moves down the plain concrete corridors, arrives at a door, and positions himself strategically to one side of it. Using a tool, he carefully picks the lock and enters cautiously, peering around the door into the plainly furnished, empty living room. Closing the door quietly behind him, he walks further into the apartment when suddenly a switch-blade flicks open. A man leaps through the glass doors, swinging the blade wildly and with intent. Bond reacts swiftly, slamming him through the glass into the bedroom. The man quickly recovers and swings again, but Bond counters with the phone. The man goes down and finds a pair of scissors. Bond slams him into a wall, gets head-butted, then retaliates by hitting him with a book. He parries the knife blows and grabs the man's knife hand in a finger-breaking hold. They crash through a window out onto a balcony. Bond has him by the throat and, with calculated force, drives the scissors into the man's neck and thigh. Bond remains completely unmoved as the man rolls his eyes in agony, then dies, blood pooling beneath his head. He proceeds to search the rooms, taking a shirt from a wardrobe and ripping it to make a makeshift bandage for a cut on his arm. He shrugs on the shirt and wipes blood from his nose. Barely glancing at the lifeless body, he grabs the door keys and heads downstairs. He turns to the young black woman at reception with a grim and determined demeanor.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: The towering gantry structure moves with an almost methodical slowness, deliberately rotating and gently relocating Bond further away from the gun while simultaneously and steadily pulling Mitchell off the scaffold. Suddenly, with a jarring jolt, the rogue agent finds himself landing with unnerving precariousness on a nearby scaffold tower. Bond, fueled by sheer determination, firmly pulls at the tightly wound rope encircling his leg. He begins a resolute climb upward, reaching out for a gun that is strategically positioned on the scaffold, even as he simultaneously attempts to retrieve the one lying on the ground below. Both men manage to pick up their respective weapons, with Bond firing his shot with impeccable precision and accuracy. Meanwhile, the bustling crowds in the busy Town Square are quickly dispersing in all directions as a police car navigates its way down the crowded street with caution. Covered in a fine layer of dust, Bond strides with purpose through the throngs of people, making his way towards the wooden gate that leads into the tunnel. Blood stains are noticeably visible on the cellar floor, yet the prisoner, Mr. White, cannot be found anywhere. Bond stares at the scene with a detached and unreadable expression. Outside, as steady rain falls, a sleek black Range Rover arrives in front of a towering high-rise block of flats. M stands pensively, gazing out from one of the balconies. Bond exits from the Range Rover and enters the building through its pristine glass door. He pays no heed to the stolid guard who stands watch, moving past him to enter a specific flat, where he encounters masked forensics officers and then joins M on the balcony. The boffin opens a door for M, graciously allowing her to enter. Meanwhile, Bond's eyes are narrowed as he sits in the back of a taxi, now wearing shades, as it drives down a dusty street. He steps out of the taxi right opposite the faded sign marking the entrance to the Hotel Dessalines. Clad in a dark polo shirt and light trousers, he makes his way into the building through the drab-tiled lobby, which is festooned with washing lines. Traversing the plain concrete corridors, he arrives at a particular door and positions himself strategically to one side of it. With meticulous care, he uses a tool to pick the lock, entering cautiously, peering around the door into the plainly furnished, empty living room. Closing the door quietly behind him, he ventures further into the apartment, when unexpectedly, a switch-blade flicks open. A man suddenly leaps through the glass doors, swinging the blade wildly and with malicious intent. Bond reacts with swiftness, slamming the attacker through the glass into the adjoining bedroom. The assailant quickly recovers and swings again, but Bond counters with a phone. The man goes down, reaching for a pair of scissors. Bond slams him into a wall, suffers a head-butt, then retaliates by hitting the attacker with a book. He skillfully parries the knife blows and seizes the man's knife-wielding hand in a finger-breaking hold. They crash through a window out onto the balcony, where Bond, with calculated force, grips his opponent by the throat and drives the scissors into the man's neck and thigh. Bond remains completely unmoved as the man's eyes roll in agony before he dies, blood pooling beneath his head. Unfazed, Bond proceeds to search the room, retrieving a shirt from a wardrobe and tearing it to fashion a makeshift bandage for a cut on his arm. He shrugs into the shirt and wipes blood from his nose with an almost casual air. Sparing only a brief glance at the now lifeless body, he grabs the door keys and heads downstairs. He then turns to the young black woman at reception, his demeanor grim and determined.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: As the gantry begins to rotate, it gradually shifts Bond away from the gun while simultaneously pulling Mitchell off the scaffold. Mitchell lands with a thud on a scaffold tower, and Bond quickly tugs at the rope that is tightly wound around his leg. With determination, he starts to climb towards a gun that is perched on the scaffold, while Bond, with equal urgency, attempts to reach the gun lying on the ground. Both men manage to scoop up their respective weapons, and Bond swiftly fires. Meanwhile, in the Town Square, the crowds begin to disperse as a police car slowly navigates its way down the congested street. Covered in a layer of dust, Bond strides purposefully through the thinning crowds, making his way towards a wooden gate that leads into a tunnel. Inside, the cellar floor is stained with blood, but the prisoner, Mr. White, is nowhere to be found. Bond stares at the scene with a dispassionate expression. Outside, rain begins to fall as a black Range Rover arrives at a towering block of flats. M stands on one of the balconies, gazing out. Bond emerges from the Range Rover, strides confidently through the building's glass door, and, without acknowledging the stolid guard, enters a flat. He passes by masked forensics officers and joins M on the balcony. A boffin opens a door for M, and Bond's eyes narrow as he now sits in the back of a taxi, wearing shades, driving down a dusty street. He exits the taxi opposite the faded sign and entrance to the Hotel Dessalines. Dressed in a dark polo shirt and light trousers, he enters the building and navigates through the drab-tiled lobby, which is strung with washing lines. He moves down the plain concrete corridors, arrives at a door, and positions himself strategically to one side of it. Using a tool, he deftly picks the lock and cautiously enters, peering around the door into the plainly furnished, empty living room. After closing the door behind him, he walks further into the apartment when suddenly, a switch-blade flicks open. A man leaps through the glass doors, swinging the blade wildly. Bond reacts quickly, slamming the man through the glass into the bedroom. The man recovers and swings the blade again, but Bond counters by attacking with a phone. The man goes down and scrambles to find a pair of scissors. Bond seizes the opportunity to slam him into a wall, but the man retaliates with a head-butt. Bond responds by hitting him with a book, parrying the knife blows, and then grabbing the man's knife hand in a finger-breaking hold. Their struggle takes them through a window and out onto a balcony. Bond grips the man by the throat and drives the scissors into his neck and thigh. Unmoved by the violence, Bond watches as the man's eyes roll in agony before he dies, blood pooling beneath his head. Bond then methodically searches the rooms, taking a shirt from a wardrobe and tearing it to fashion a makeshift bandage for a cut on his arm. He shrugs on the shirt and wipes blood from his nose. Barely glancing at the lifeless body, he grabs the door keys and heads downstairs. With a grim demeanor, he turns to the young black woman at reception.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description:
The gantry shifts, moving Bond away from the gun and pulling Mitchell off the scaffold, where he lands on a tower. As Bond frees himself from the rope, both men scramble for their weapons, and Bond fires. Amidst the dispersing crowds in the Town Square, Bond, covered in dust, strides toward a wooden gate in the tunnel. Inside, he finds blood stains on the cellar floor, but Mr. White, the prisoner, is gone. Bond observes the scene dispassionately. 

In the rain, a black Range Rover arrives at a high-rise block of flats, where M stands on a balcony. Bond exits the vehicle, enters the building, and passes a stolid guard and masked forensics officers to join M on the balcony. Later, Bond, now wearing shades, rides in the back of a taxi down a dusty street. He exits opposite the Hotel Dessalines, enters the building, and navigates through the drab-tiled lobby and plain corridors. Reaching a door, he picks the lock and cautiously enters the empty living room. 

Suddenly, a man with a switchblade leaps through glass doors. Bond slams him into the bedroom, and as the man recovers, Bond counters with a phone and a book, eventually subduing him with a finger-breaking hold. They crash through a window onto a balcony, where Bond fatally stabs the man with scissors. Unmoved, Bond searches the rooms, using a ripped shirt as a bandage for his arm and wiping blood from his nose. He takes the door keys, barely glances at the body, and heads downstairs, turning to the young woman at reception with a grim demeanor.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: The gantry turns, a pivotal mechanism in industrial settings used for lifting and moving heavy objects, moving Bond away from the gun and pulling Mitchell off the scaffold. The rogue agent lands on a scaffold tower, a temporary structure often used in construction for support, as Bond pulls at the rope around his leg. He climbs for a gun on the scaffold while Bond tries to reach the one on the ground, a typical Walther PPK, which Bond often carries for its compact size and reliability. Both scoop up the weapons, and Bond fires, his shot echoing through the large, open space. The crowds are dispersing in the Town Square, a typical gathering place in many European cities often surrounded by historic architecture, as a police car makes its way down a crowded street. Covered in dust, Bond strides through the crowds towards the wooden gate in the tunnel, an old passageway likely used for centuries. Blood stains the cellar floor, creating a grim reminder of the violent confrontation, but the prisoner, Mr. White, a notorious figure in the criminal world, is gone. Bond stares dispassionately at the scene, his experience with such violence dulling his reaction. It's raining when a black Range Rover, a popular choice for its luxury and performance, arrives at a high-rise block of flats, a modern apartment complex. M stands looking out from one of the balconies, contemplating the situation below. Bond emerges from the Range Rover and enters through the building's glass door, its modern design contrasting with the dreariness outside. Ignoring a stolid guard, trained to remain impassive, Bond enters a flat, passes masked forensics officers, who meticulously search for every clue, and joins M on the balcony. The boffin, an expert in their field possibly dealing with technology, opens a door for M. Bond's eyes narrow as he is now wearing shades in the back of a taxi, driving down a dusty street, typical of many remote or developing areas. He gets out of the taxi opposite the faded sign and entrance to the Hotel Dessalines, a modest accommodation probably named after the Haitian revolutionary leader, Jean-Jacques Dessalines. In a dark polo shirt and light trousers, Bond enters the building and makes his way through the drab-tiled lobby, strung with washing lines, indicating its use by long-term or low-income residents. He moves down plain concrete corridors, arrives at a door, and positions himself to one side of it, ensuring he's ready for any surprises. He uses a tool to pick the lock, a skill honed from years of espionage, and enters cautiously, peering around the door into the plainly furnished, empty living room, which suggests sparse or transient habitation. Closing the door behind him, he walks into the apartment when a switch-blade flicks open, a weapon often associated with rapid, close-quarters attacks. A man, possibly another agent or a criminal, leaps through glass doors, swinging the blade wildly. Bond slams him through the glass into the bedroom, using the impact to disorient him. The man recovers and swings again, but Bond attacks with the phone, improvising with whatever is at hand. He goes down and finds a pair of scissors, a common tool that becomes a weapon in desperate situations. Bond slams him into a wall, gets head-butted, then hits him with a book, demonstrating his adaptability and resourcefulness. He parries the knife blows and grabs the guy's knife hand in a finger-breaking hold, a technique likely learned through advanced combat training. They go through a window out onto a balcony, the fragile barrier between safety and a precipitous drop. Bond has him by the throat and drives the scissors into the guy's neck and thigh, a brutal but necessary act of self-defense. Bond's completely unmoved as the guy rolls his eyes in agony, then dies, blood pooling beneath his head, a stark testament to the lethal world of espionage. He goes to search the rooms, taking a shirt from a wardrobe and ripping it to make a bandage for a cut on his arm, demonstrating his quick thinking and ability to use whatever's available. He shrugs on a shirt and wipes blood from his nose, maintaining his composure. Barely glancing at the body, he grabs the door keys and heads downstairs. He turns to the young black woman at reception, likely familiar with the risks of her environment, with a grim demeanor, signifying the gravity of the situation they've just faced.

M stands looking out from one of the balconies. Bond emerges from the Range Rover and enters through the building's glass door. Ignoring a stolid guard. Bond enters a flat passes masked forensics officers and joins M on the balcony. The boffin opens a door for M. Bond's eyes narrow as he is now wearing shades in the back of a taxi driving down a dusty street. He gets out of the taxi opposite the faded sign and entrance to the Hotel Dessalines. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. In a dark polo shirt and light trousers he enters the building and makes his way through the drabtiled lobby strung with washing lines. He moves down plain concrete corridors arrives at a door and positions himself to one side of it. He uses a tool to pick the lock and enters cautiously peering around the door into the plainly furnished empty living room. Closing the door behind him he walks into the apartment when a switchblade flicks open. A man leaps through glass doors swinging the blade wildly. Bond slams him through the glass into the bedroom. The man recovers and swings again but Bond attacks with the phone. He goes down and finds a pair of scissors. Bond slams him into a wall gets headbutted then hits him with a book. He parries the knife blows and grabs the guy's knife hand in a fingerbreaking hold. They go through a window out onto a balcony. Bond has him by the throat and drives the scissors into the guy's neck and thigh. Bond's completely unmoved as the guy rolls his eyes in agony then dies blood pooling beneath his head. He goes to search the rooms taking a shirt from a wardrobe and ripping it to make a bandage for a cut on his arm. He shrugs on a shirt and wipes blood from his nose. Barely glancing at the body he grabs the door keys and heads downstairs. He turns to the young black woman at reception with a grim demeanor.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: The gantry turns moving Bond away from the gun and pulling Mitchell off the scaffold. The rogue agent lands on a scaffold tower as Bond pulls at the rope around his leg. He climbs for a gun on the scaffold while Bond tries to reach the one on the ground. Both scoop up the weapons and Bond fires. The crowds are dispersing in the Town Square as a police car makes its way down a crowded street. Covered in dust Bond strides through the crowds towards the wooden gate in the tunnel. Blood stains the cellar floor but the prisoner Mr White is gone. Bond stares dispassionately at the scene. Bond slams him into a wall gets headbutted then hits him with a book. He parries the knife blows and grabs the guy's knife hand in a fingerbreaking hold. They go through a window out onto a balcony. Bond has him by the throat and drives the scissors into the guy's neck and thigh. Bond's completely unmoved as the guy rolls his eyes in agony then dies blood pooling beneath his head. He goes to search the rooms taking a shirt from a wardrobe and ripping it to make a bandage for a cut on his arm. He shrugs on a shirt and wipes blood from his nose. Barely glancing at the body he grabs the door keys and heads downstairs. He turns to the young black woman at reception with a grim demeanor.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~80%)
test_cases.description: The gantry turns moving Bond away from the gun and pulling Mitchell off the scaffold. The rogue agent lands on a scaffold tower as Bond pulls at the rope around his leg. He climbs for a gun on the scaffold while Bond tries to reach the one on the ground. He goes to search the rooms taking a shirt from a wardrobe and ripping it to make a bandage for a cut on his arm. He shrugs on a shirt and wipes blood from his nose. Barely glancing at the body he grabs the door keys and heads downstairs. He turns to the young black woman at reception with a grim demeanor.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The platform spins, whisking the musician away from the sculpture and dragging the artist off the podium. The rogue chef crashes onto a ladder tower, as the musician tugs at the string around his arm. He ascends for a book on the ladder while the musician attempts to reach the one on the floor. Both snatch up the novels, and the musician whispers. The gatherings are scattering in the Market Plaza as a fire truck makes its way down a bustling avenue. Covered in paint, the musician glides through the gatherings towards the metal gate in the alley. Ink stains the attic ceiling, but the guest, Mr. Blue, is missing. The musician gazes indifferently at the situation. It's snowing when a red van halts at an apartment block of offices. A stands peering out from one of the terraces. The musician exits from the van and strolls through the building's wooden entryway. Disregarding a grumpy butler, the musician enters an office, passes hooded sanitation workers, and meets A on the terrace. The engineer closes a window for A. The musician's eyes squint as he is now wearing gloves in the back of a yacht, floating down an icy river. He steps off the yacht opposite the bright billboard and gateway to the Library Bellamore. In a bright jacket and dark jeans, he steps inside the structure and makes his way through the opulent-tiled atrium, hung with banners. He maneuvers down elegant marble hallways, arrives at an archway, and positions himself to one side of it. He uses a device to unlock the gate and enters stealthily, glancing around the arch into the lavishly decorated, unoccupied dining room. Closing the archway behind him, he ambles into the restaurant when a corkscrew twists open. A woman vaults through velvet curtains, swinging the corkscrew wildly. The musician throws her through the curtains into the cellar. The woman regains balance and swings again, but the musician counters with the candle. She collapses and finds a fork. The musician smashes her into a pillar, gets shoved, then strikes her with a map. He deflects the corkscrew thrusts and grips the woman's corkscrew arm in a wrist-twisting clutch. They tumble through a gate out onto a terrace. The musician has her by the collar and drives the fork into the woman's collar and waist. The musician's completely unperturbed as the woman rolls her eyes in discomfort, then slumbers, ink pooling beneath her neck. He proceeds to search the chambers, taking a jacket from a closet and tearing it to fashion a sling for a mark on his hand. He throws on a jacket and cleans ink from his cheek. Barely noticing the figure, he grabs the window latches and heads upstairs. He turns to the elderly white boy at information with a cheerless expression.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Bond finds himself in a tense confrontation with the rogue agent Mitchell, both scrambling for their guns amidst a scaffold tower. After neutralizing the threat, Bond navigates through a dispersing crowd in the Town Square, noticing Mr. White’s disappearance from a blood-stained cellar. Amidst rain, Bond arrives at a high-rise to meet M, bypassing security to stand with her on a balcony. Soon after, he discreetly travels to the Hotel Dessalines, maneuvering through its unremarkable corridors until he confronts a man wielding a switchblade. A brutal fight ensues, leading Bond to kill the attacker with scissors. Unfazed, Bond tends to his wounds, searches the apartment, and exits, leaving behind the grim scene. He moves past a young woman at reception, maintaining a stoic demeanor.
